Fields.DialogueText: Ah... So, this is Stockholm! ... You know, Captain, this place feels kind of familiar to me.

Fields.MenuText: Is it the trees? They're kind of distinct.
Oh! It's the buildings, isn't it? They're really...
(*shivering*) What tipped you off?

Fields.DialogueText: Captain, you can't be freezing, can you? I had them pick that coat out for you specifically for this! It even has a tiny Minnesota pin on it! ... I made that pin especially for you, too.
They quite remind me of the Twin Cities. Roofing, color, sidings... Oh! They've even got some graffiti! Captain, is that a fish or a hawk? I can't tell. Maybe it's a horse?
Good eye, Captain. You've got some oaks right there, a few maples, some birch... Oh, are those pines!? I'll have to get a few pictures of those. The reference material will be wonderful...
This place has got a lot to it despite being kind of out of the way to get to.
But it'll be so worth it! Ah, to finally be in one of the sisters of the home country. Now all I need is a nice cup of hot chocolate, some wild rice soup, and a pair of mittens...
I'd like some mittens, please. Hopefully they have some left over from the surplus we sent to Ireland.
I made sure to send a lot of shepherd's pie with that surplus, too. Hope they like it! And, Captain, don't worry. I'll knit you some when I have the time.
Here you are getting me riled up over mittens of all things! I swear, Minneapolis you could make saltlicks sound like they were the best thing since sliced bread.
They're quite healthy for deer, y'know? And, Captain, it's like you said: it's all about viewing things from other perspectives. ... Speaking of which, where's our welcome party?
Don't know. Maybe they got lost on the way here?
Come now, Captain. They *live* in this city! Their sense of direction can't be *that* poor!
Mind telling me the difference between North Minneapolis and South Minneapolis, then?
Gladly! The North Side has a ton of culture and communities that are tightly knit. But... there are some problems.
Good news, found our welcome party.
Why are you frowning, Captain?
Because the welcome wagon isn't the Swedes, it's some familiar friends.
Troublesome kids... Captain, I'm in the mood for some lumberjacking.
Would you mind teaching me how to hold an axe? I've been looking to get into making some firewood for the winter, and you seem like you're the best to ask for that.
C-Captain... Well, it's easy. Here, hold my hand. You just raise it up, steady your feet, aim for the weak part of the log, and...
@BATTLE
And I'll make sure they've got the love of the north in every thread. Count on that!
South Side is full of rich bigwigs. They're apart mostly, but they know how to party and-
Captain! I've come back from my little excursion.

Fields.MenuText: Oh, what's... Why do you have so *many* bags!?
You sure that excursion wasn't a treasure hunt?
That isn't an excursion. That's an adventure in your hands.

Fields.DialogueText: This isn't anything, Captain. You haven't seen me when it's Beer Cheese Soup Day on deck. That's when we start getting into ridiculous baggage territory.
If I found treasure, I would've ran back here and told the crew! It's not right to hoard a discovery for yourself.
It wasn't much of an adventure without you there, Captain. You were asleep this morning and I didn't want to wake you up! But, we'll have plenty of time for adventure on this trip - I know it!
Well whatever or wherever you went, I hope they gave you a fair deal!
Believe me when I say: I only bought this bag right here with a bit of utensils. The rest come from the locals; boy, are they excited to see us!
I wonder what the occasion is, then? They told us that most of the problems being dealt with here are the Morgana and nothing else.
Maybe they've never seen a Belle like me before? A lot of them commented on how nice my hat is and a few of them asked where they could get one? I was so flattered...
They aren't wrong, it's a very nice hat, and I myself would love one. But, who knows really? My theory is that nobody else wants to get involved here.
Why is that, Captain? Do you think it's because it's too cold here? Well, then again - there IS Russia.
I think it has to do with Sweden's neutrality. I know some of the higher ups I've talked to aren't happy with letting those Nazis run around here.
I'm not happy about that fact either; but, that's Sweden's choice, not ours. Hm, that reminds me, Captain. A few of the locals were talking about a special spot where you can see the Northern Lights.
Oh, I think I know where that is. Kiruna, right? But, you can't get there on land... Damn, if only Norway would let us there to see them.
Agreed! Grgh, I want to see them so much with you! You know what they say about the Northern Lights, don't you?
Norse Mythology, if I'm not mistaken. They're a gift from the gods for humanity's hard work, and they bring deep warmth along with love with them.
My, my! You're well read, Captain... Ahem! Yes, they bring all of those, and I'd love to see them with you. The locals spoke quite highly of them and I think it'd be perfect.
I definitely would love to after we finish our business.
I don't know how we'll get to that village in the end, either... Hmph! I'll find a way; I've done it before. Oh! By the way, Captain, what do you want for dinner?
I would love to have some of your porchetta. I remember we have some material for it. Do you want me to make you anything?
Why... Captain! I'd love it if you made me some of your -
*ALARM*
- some peace and quiet with my Captain. Stupid... blasted... Morgana...
@BATTLE
Lord knows I want to share what I've found with you of all people - I would've broke down your door!
(Salvo, gunfire, and orders fly through the air. The seas around Stockholm, once calm, are now aflame with Morgana.)
Minneapolis, we've got company coming from the left!
Ah..? Ah! Y-Yes! Leave it to me, Captain! These brats won't know what hit them! Skol!
@BATTLE
And don't come back until you've all learned proper manners! Damn things, interrupting my time with the Captain—
We can make more time later, y'know?
A-Ah! You heard that...  (*pause*) I would like more time to plot course with you, Captain. And I feel like it's time I upgraded my arsenal to accomplish that.
You already have a ton of arsenal as it is. You have so many gun barrels that you might as well be a beehive!
You can never be too prepared, Captain. There's good merit in having more firepower... (Especially if it means I can see you more.)

Fields.MenuText: I don't feel like you can say that when you have eight Triple 203/55s.
Minneapolis... Are you jealous of the other Belles?
I think I'm the problem. Maybe I should re-evaluate my tactics?

Fields.DialogueText: No! No! Captain, please. You're wonderful, and don't let anyone tell you otherwise!
Jealous!? No, Captain. Jealousy may be a normal emotion and a part of our existence.
Those are good at keeping out the hibernating critters at the winter, Captain. Morgana like these are going to require more... persuasion. And that persuasion to me would be a large main cannon...
Well, if you're really adamant, I'll put in a request to HQ about it. What were you thinking about, Minneapolis?
I've heard that there have been some experiments with improving blast penetration. I'm really interested in that. I'm not one for explosives usually, but the *sound* I've heard is... exquisite.
For someone so cute, you've got a bit of danger to you.
Cute... Do you really think so? (I-I'm so...)
Of course! I mean look at that hat and jacket. You can't get better than that. Oh, that reminds me, are we going to knit the mittens today?
Yes, Captain! R-Right away. Let's go to my quarters! Oh, you'll love it. I bought red threads specifically.
Can you teach me how to make a maple leaf? I heard it's got some special significance to it.
(*blushing*) (D-Does the Captain realize what that really means!?) A-Ahem, yes, I'd love to show you how. Come on, Captain; get those thimbles ready!
(Enter stage left, Minneapolis and her mighty Captain! Together in battle, with divine inspiration, and tender...)
But! In my book, jealousy should be used as a way to efficacy. Don't want what others have, want more for yourself! And for me? A big cannon!
I just want to get things done faster, you know? That way, we'd have more time to talk about important things: like dates... a-and times! Yes.
Where is our contact, Captain? It's about 10 minutes past the hour and I don't appreciate late people... It gets me steaming quick...
It'll be okay, Minneapolis. I just got word from the docks. Our contact is here and apparently brought food...
(The doors of the Mess Hall burst open. A blonde haired man, tall as a tree, and carrying a crate looks around exasperatedly.)
Ursäkta mig! Oh, you must be the Captain of this fine vessel. And you, the USS Minneapolis! Ogh... Please, forgive me for my absolute lateness. I have no excuse!
Manners make a man. Pleased to meet you. You must be Harald; I am the USS Minneapolis, and this is my captain. It'll be a pleasure to work with you.
Ah, Minneapolis, Captain, pleased to meet you both. Welcome to Sweden! Now first, let me ask you both a question: are you hungry?

Fields.MenuText: We actually haven't eaten lunch yet.
Do you Swedes have an expression for 'I could eat a horse'?
Well, I would. But Minneapolis filled me right up with her lovely cooking.

Fields.DialogueText: I have some stuff on the stove, however, I'm rather curious to see what you have, Harald. I've never tried authentic Swedish cuisine before!
The words you're looking for, Captain, are: jag svälter. And yes, I agree. Even though things are stewing on the stove, I could go for a bite to eat right now.
That *I* did. Thank you Captain. (Yes! Score 2 for me today!) However, we haven't had lunch yet. What do you have in mind, Harald? You've got my attention.
Well then, let me just get my crate up on here. You both are going to love these... I bring you pyttipana, with potatoes and steak. To you, I gift! I made it myself.
Well, allow me to take a bite... (*munch*) (*munch*) ... Oh my..!
Man, that's good. Is this something you have often, Harald?
Thank you both, very much! It's something I often have these days thanks to supplies being a bit lower. But, I guess when the world's at war...
Indeed. And, we've come to help alleviate some of the war that's come here uninvited. That, and maybe bring some joy along with us, too.
Well you both couldn't have come at a better time! Morgana attacks have been ramping up, the people are scared, and we're having to contend with pressures from both sides of the world.
Lucky you, Harald. The Captain and I not only know how to deal with these troublemaking children, but we also know how to throw a big party. Of course! Party comes after hard work.
Yes! Yes! I know that better than anyone. Hard work allows for talent to be made, muscles to be built, and worlds to be turned.
*ALARM*
Well then! It's time to do some heavy lifting!
Let's get moving then! Skol, Harald!
Skål, Minneapolis! Captain! Let's move out!
@BATTLE
(When he spots Minneapolis and the Captain, he says something underneath his breath and immediately runs over.)
Captain? May I come in? I've brought dinner.
Ah, good to see you, Minneapolis. Sure, just set that over there. Sorry if this place is messy right now, just running over reports.
Hmmm... Wait, Sweden wants to remain neutral? Why? Don't they realize that those Nazis are...
Harald told me yesterday about it. Sweden doesn't want to enter wars, and hasn't done so since the Napoleonic era.
They've been neutral for *that* long!? Hmm... But, don't they realize the circumstances that we're in? I mean, look at the Axis!
The U.S has also chosen to remain neutral for the time being as well, you know. I guess we're all just weighing our options.
Captain... I've heard some things from Eliezer lately and that's why i want to ask. He says he has a friend in Germany that he hasn't heard from since... since Kristallnacht. You know what that is?
... I don't know what to say. I'll have to talk with Eliezer. But, don't misconstrue my words. I understand what you're thinking and...
Call it what you want, Captain. I just... I feel like we should be doing more than we already are. Is that so wrong? Am I blowing this out of the tea kettle and onto the stove?

Fields.MenuText: I don't think you are, but our hands are tied.
We may be working with Germany, now, but that won't always be true.
Minneapolis, I'm sorry.

Fields.DialogueText: It's frustrating, knowing that all of this is happening in front of you and yet you can't do anything about it. I... Eliezer was... I just want so desperately to help him and others out.

I understand that, but, what happens when help arrives too late? I... I don't want to find out the answer to that, but we can't... we can't do anything! I..! Grrgh... Feels like we aren't doing our job!
Captain... You don't need to apologize to me! I understand what's going on and will abide by it. But this is... I can't believe people would just let this happen? Why can't we protect them?
Minneapolis, do you want to know what I know?
What, Captain..?

We're out here in Sweden, on a mission to protect people, and with one of the best crews anyone could ask for. We can do our best and no more than that. And I want to do my best with you, Minneapolis.
(...My heart...) (*blush*) Captain, thank you. It's... It's still frustrating.
I feel you on that. We've got all this power and we can't do everything with it. But, we should do our best with what we can do.
Do I do, Captain. And, I'll make sure tha the best is yet to come. You can count on that!
Can I count on you now? I see some Morgana peeking at those fishing vessels across the way.
They're in for a rude awakening if they think that I'll just let them do that to those innocent fishermen. Captain?
Already on it.
@BATTLE
I can't believe how much they're doing, even while Morgana attack everywhere...
Yeah.
These recipes that were given to me by Harald are quite nice... They're fun to make, too!
Sure smells delicious. What is it?
Harald called it "kottbullar," but it's basically meatballs... Mhmhm~ These are really good ones, too. The spice blend in this recipe is killer! Can't wait to taste...
Neither can I...  You're doing great, Minneapolis.
Staring at me like I'm some kinda statue or something...
Marcus! Good to see you... What's going on?
Oh, heya, Minneapolis, Captain. It's those Swedes. We were supposed to be training with them today, and during training all they did was just... stare at me.
Staring? Was it because you were doing well?
It ain't the good kind of stares, that's for sure.
Well, did you do anything that might upset them, Marcus? People don't usually stare for no reason.

Fields.MenuText: Minneapolis, I think they were staring at Marcus because of maybe his skin..?
Unless they've never seen someone like him before?
Don't you stare at me often, Minneapolis?

Fields.DialogueText: What..? What's wrong with Marcus' skin? I don't see any blemishes anywhere... Have you not been eating well, Marcus? I hear starvation makes people go pale...
Oh, come now, Captain. I'm fairly certain that there are people of African descent around here! Heck, some of them might be Americans, too!
(You noticed!?) Erm... Captain, the way I stare at you—if I did, is a lot different than how people would look at someone like Marcus.
Hmm... Marcus, what did you end up saying to them?
I asked them what was going on and they kind of gasped a bit. Then they looked away as if they didn't do a thing... Makes me a bit angry - if you've got something to say to me, say it!
I agree! It's better if we make mistakes first and talk them out. That's how we learn the best!
You know, actually... something about this is kind of fami—
*ALARM*
No time, huh? Well. Marcus, rally the lower decks! Minneapolis, you're with me.
Hell, yeah! I needed some action!
W-Wait, Captain, I need to turn the stove to low!!!
@BATTLE
Those are the kind of blank stares you get when somebody in a beer hall goes: "Hey fellas, how about we stop drinking?" Seriously, it was like I did something wrong.
It's because... because... (*pause*) I'm certain it's not like how they stared at Marcus.
Unless it is! I don't mean to judge!
... We just haven't seen them yet.
... Oooooh. Harald is *LATE* agaiiiiin...
Please, Minneapolis. I feel your annoyance, but Harald said this was important.
I came as fast as I couuuuuuld! Sorry, sorry! Ahem, Captain, Minneapolis, I have something from my superiors.
At ease, Harald. Read as follows if you can, or summarize if you feel like. But, don't leave out the important details, all right?
Thank you, thank you. Yes. Command has told me that they'd like you to head Kalmar. There's some problems in the strait. They also want me and my partner, yes, to go with you!
And why do they want you to come with? Don't they need you here? It seems kind of bad that they'd send our contact out with us, wouldn't it?

Fields.MenuText: Yeah, that kind of defeats the purpose. Do they not trust us?
Maybe this will be a good time to explore more of the culture?
I wouldn't mind Harald coming along, if it means we can get more time for ourselves.

Fields.DialogueText: Why, we're the most trustworthy Captain and Belle this side of the north! You couldn't find a better duo! What's the meaning of this, Harald? Uff da, does your commander have a few screws loose?
I'd enjoy that! Nothing better than experiencing something new. But, I'm curious, Harald. Why would they still send you after us? Did we do something wrong? Or, did we overstay?
For sure! If we get this done fast enough... Hoohoo, I wonder if that town's got a supperclub? (Does it come with lit candles and... couples nights?)
Please don't get wrong! They're having us sent with you so that we can provide guides and local support...
Draug? Oh for crying out... We already have Morgana to contend with -- we don't need that mess! But, I understand. What about you, Captain? Are you okay with this?
I am, after all, we need all the help we can get. Besides, Minneapolis. With you around, I don't think we have anything to be afraid of.
(Oh for cute...) Well, I can't argue with that. Besides, we've got enough firepower -- much less a good Captain to guide us -- anyhow! So, Harald? Are you all set to go?
It will take a day to prepare! But once done, me and my partner will come along.
That gives me enough time to make the pot roast! Haha! Knew I had enough time for that. Captain, do you have any suggestions for...
Good grief... Captain, we've got stuff to do.
Seems to me like the Draug's cousins have found us. How good of a shot are you, Harald?
Very good! Also, I can't tell you how many generations of whalers are in my family. Give me a harpoon and I'll show you magic.
@BATTLE
But, Harald, why are you coming along with us? This isn't a trip to the cabin.
The high-ups are also want to see how you all deal with the Draug... or, are they called Morganas? Either way, that's why.
If we do encounter some random Draug, it'll be just another thing we handle.
We're about halfway down the straight now, Captain. No sign of any Morgana yet.
Maybe they decided to start taking naps today? Still, nice to have some downtime while you prepare yourself.
Reminds me, I should probably start on my next wood carving. You got any ideas roaming around in that noggin of yours?

Fields.MenuText: Odin commanding his Valyries?
Maybe you should do one of Stockholm?
How about one of yourself, Minneapolis?

Fields.DialogueText: Odin? Isn't he the 'All-Father' in Norse Mythology? Hm, it'd be nice to maybe get a mural of him.
The skyline would be lovely... Though, I'd have to take just the right picture.
O-One of me!? Well... Hm, I've never tried a self-portrait before. I'm kind of worried on how it'll turn out. Could you help me out with that, Captain?
No matter what we do, I feel like I'm going to enjoy it with you.
Captain... I know I'll enjoy it with you, too...
(Footsteps upon wood. Someone approaches that's unfamiliar to both Captain and Belle.)
Oh, hello. You must be...
Gunhild is my name. I'm Harald's compatriot. You are Minneapolis, you are the Captain.. We will work together from here on.
I'm sure we'll have much to discuss. Nice to meet you, Gunhild.
This straight is not easy. I speak from experience. Americans, Germans... Both of them invading our waters. Hmph. I'm glad it's at least for good reason this time.
Uh-huh...
Captain, yes? Morgana, ahead. We will discuss more later. Prepare for battle.
Straight to the point then.
(Ish... Something about her is rubbing me the wrong way...)
Minneapolis?
Y-Yes, ready for battle, Captain. Let's go together.
@BATTLE
I know! When we get back to Stockholm, I'll consult the library and see where I can find references. (And maybe find some romance novels..?)
I think having you there would help me out a lot, Captain. You do have a nice sense of angles. (I want to hold you while you take that shot...)
'C-Cause, you probably know what side I look best from... Er, I-I mean!!
Captain, we've made it!
I didn't think so many Morganas would be around, but Harald wasn't kidding.
No he wasn't. Half the time in that straight I thought I was shooting fish in a barrel. I wish we could've scooted past them and then recharged here. The saltwater is making me tired...
It's too bad most of the ocean is saltwater, ain't it?
The sass on you today! Hmph... (It is pretty cute.) I don't hate it, but... You better watch your mouth --
Captain, I'd like to file a complaint with those Swedes.
Marcus!? What's going on? Why do you want to lodge a complaint?
That new girl... What's her name? Gunhild? Anyway, new girl just flat out walks up to me, pushes down the magazine I'm reading and asks: "Are you more pale under your socks?"
W-What!? Why would *anyone* ask that!? I knew she was gonna be trouble, but...
All I know is that I don't want to work with her if she's going to throw crap like that at me.
I can't believe she'd just... And then for all of them to start doing that to my boys is just..!

Fields.MenuText: I'm noticing something familiar here.
Now hold on. Gunhild's stiff, but not rude; she's to the point.
... I'm starting to think there are no dark skinned people in Sweden.

Fields.DialogueText: I didn't want to admit it at first... But, that might be it. That's why she probably asked that. Still... That's incredibly rude! Who would just go out of their way to ask something so horrible?
Being to the point is the problem here, Captain! You can't just go up to someone and ask why they look the way they look! Much less asking why they talk the way they talk, or do the things they do!
Familiar? What's so familiar about this!? Marcus just got insulted... Oogh...
Huh, this is kinda familiar...
What on earth are you talking about Marcus? There's nothing familiar about this at all.
Mmm, anyway, point is: there's obviously some confusion here. I think I have an idea on how to clear this up.
If it doesn't involve giving her a long 'talk'... Ooogh, I don't want to hear it. Stuff like that gets me right steamed...
I understand both of your frustrations. But we don't get through most issues with our fists -- we talk them out. Besides, we've done it before, haven't we?
Captain, I think we're about to fight with our fists if what I'm seeing out the window's true.
Minneapolis, get all of that out of your system now. I don't want you doing that later.
I can't promise I'll get *all* of it out, Captain...
@BATTLE
That's like walking up to Feng and going, "Why are your eyes slanted?" No doubt she asked THAT, too. I've been hearing others are getting it, too.
Who does she think she is? Coming into my quarters, insulting my boys, and then acting like what she believes was true? Who does that!?
Captain, Minneapolis! You wanted to see me about something?
Yes we did, Harald. It's about Gunhild and some of the other soldiers. We've been receiving complaints from a couple of people about their conduct.
Conduct!? Oh, dear, Captain. I already apologize for most of it. What going on?
A couple of my boys have said your soldiers are harassing them and making them feel isolated. Yesterday, one of ours reported that Gunhild asked him... well, questions about his skin tone.
...Oh dear. Captain, Minneapolis, I am so sorry about this. Really.

Fields.MenuText: Guess I'm Alexander Graham Bell, because I *CALLED* it.
Well, not quite what I was expecting but...
Familiarity helps you recognize things like this.

Fields.DialogueText: I have to admit, you we're right on it, Captain. It's just so hard to believe!
Never... seen... a... I... What in the...? I can't believe this! You must be pulling my leg, Harald. You're telling me she's *never* seen anyone other than with white skin!?
What do you mean "familiar!?" F-F-F... You can't be serious with this, Harald.
It is the truth! I've gone on travels to Africa. Been far to Carribean! But Gunhild, no. She's stayed here for most of her life; only went to Germany three months ago!
Well, then - I think it's time for that plan I had earlier to come into play. Minneapolis, are you up for hosting a Booyah?
Boo... Yah? What is 'Booyah'?
Oho! Captain you have no idea how long I've waited to hear those words this trip. Harald, you'd better be ready for some American cuisine and fun..!
A party..? Why, yes! We'd love to attend! Please, allow us to bring some things as apology.
The more the merrier! Just, make sure to tell your men that houseguests have to clean up after themselves, too.
I know Minneapolis quite well, Harald. She's my partner. You'd do wise to listen to her when she says that last part.
Captain! Boiler pressure's up! Are we under attack!? My people are having a hard time maintaining temperature down there!
Y-Yes we are! Yes we are! Captain, Eliezer, Harald! Battlestations, let's go!
But those Morgana are out of reach, Minne --
Element of suuurrrrprise, Eliezer! L-Let's move!
Have at it, then!
@BATTLE
She even told me that she's never seen someone of a different skin color before. I just didn't realize she would be so... offensive about it. Oh, I do apologize! I'm sure she didn't mean any harm!
Oh, please forgive her! And forgive my men - I'm afraid many of them are like her.
Good afternoon, Captain, Minneapolis. I've got some stuff to report to you about some things with the Swedish crew.
Ah, Feng, good to see you - though I'm guessing the circumstances aren't ideal. What's up?
Those Swedes are acting a little bit better since you talked to Harald, but that... I don't know what to call her... What's her name?
Ah, Gunhild. Tell me, Feng: what did she do this time? I'm oh so eager to hear what she's done to make my boys uncomfortable...
She was less confrontational to me than she was to Marcus, though she did have some choice words about Confucius. Which... yeah, that was weird.

Fields.MenuText: What is her... deal?
Hoo boy.
... I think I have another hunch.

Fields.DialogueText: I know I should be patient... But, I'm this close to giving Gunhild a *very* long talk. I will leave *nothing* out. I will not have my boys be treated like this.
I don't understand how someone can get so far acting like... that! This... my patience is starting to wear itself out. Captain, you have to talk to command. This is real, *real* problem.
That hunch can't come soon enough, Captain. I'm not going to take this sitting down anymore like a goose at Lake Superior. Whatever you have, you'd better say it...
Relax, Minneapolis, I've got a plan: the Booyah Party is our ticket to figuring out Gunhild. Feng's encounter gave me an idea. She knows some stuff about us, but she doesn't know everything, right?
Clearly...
Captain... Are you suggesting that we make this Booyah Party one about culture and art..?
Wait, that's... genius!
Indeed I am, and I'm going to need both of you to help out. Minneapolis, I'm going to need you to work your cooking magic, as well.
Captain... (Oh, look at that determination!) Hmm! I'll do it, I'll make the best damn meal those Swedes have ever had! You can count on it! I'll have Akecheta help me out, too!
That's what I like to—
Captain! Trouble! Trouble! The town's being attacked by enemy Morganas - we need to haul it out!
...hear. All right, time for some team exercises. Minneapolis, we're going to make like the Mariners.
Oh my... Yes! YES! Right away! I'm going to show these Morgana what a *real* touchdown looks like!
Big Sis, you have stars in your—
(Shhhh... Let Minneapolis be excited, ok?)
Move it on up! We've got a game ahead of us and then a party to prep for!
Aye aye!
@BATTLE
Mostly she went on about how she doesn't like the fact that she has to work with us.
Hehe! This time it's our time. Alright everyone! Let's give Sweden a warm welcome! What do you say!?
BOOYAH! BOOYAH! BOOYAH!
Make some noise! Make some noooiiise!!!
BOOYAH! BOOYAAAAHHH!!! (*VAPID CHEERING*)
But what if I told you all we've got some uninvited guests to deal with!? Do you want them to ruin this party!?
(*RAUCOUS CHEERING AND JEERING*)
Then let's show them how we do Minnesota Nice, huh!? What do you say!?
YEAH! YOU! BETCHAAA!!!
@BATTLE
Man this place is lively. You've done a great job, Minneapolis. ...Hey, where's Harald?
He's mingling with Eliezer. Those two seem to have a lot in common... How are you, Captain, are you enjoying yourself?

Fields.MenuText: These meatballs are delicious.
Maybe it's just me, but I've got a headache.
It is, now that you're smiling again.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you, Captain! I worked very hard on them. It was actually Marcus who recommended I make them for this event. It's a bit of a blend of Swedish and American... Hope you're loving them.
Captain... (Do I dare ask..? ... Come on, Minneapolis, buck up.) Do you w-want to... Erm... How about reading a book together! Or..! Or! How about you lay down and I read to you?
Well... parties are so infectious, you know? (S-Set my heart on fire, why don't you, Captain?) And, thank you...
Minneapolis... I still want to see that Aurora. I hope we can sort this stuff out between the crews.
I hope so, too. Marcus has said that he and Joe are still having a bit of trouble. We'll have to talk to them in a bit.
Definitely! Hm... Minneapolis, would you like to sit down and have a drink in the meantime? I don't see any more Morgana about.
Why... Oh for cute—yes!
You have a lot of patience, Captain, and I need to work on that. I'm glad to smile again with you, Captain. Really...
So, I don't understand it. Everyone else is out here having fun, and you're sitting?
I don't know when the enemy will attack again. And I don't trust any of you to be alert.
Even though we've been alert before? Please, I know you're a bit upset about our circumstances—but this is a party. We're all friends here.
What's to say we can't earn it?
The Americans can't, apparently. I heard they took all your land, you're still trying to get it back, and you host those odd meetings in the middle of nowhere. What kind of existence is that?
That's not all we are, you know. If you'd let me, I'd love to tell you about what actually goes on.
Miss? Please, I don't mean to impose; but I think the best way to bridge this gap we have is for me to tell you about it. That is, if you allow me?
Spin your tales if you wish. I'll try to understand them. What I don't understand is why you people live in huts and in wooded areas.
We actually live in houses like normal people, and lodges! Let me tell you about the Dakota, I think you'll love...
... Captain?
Yes, Minneapolis?
I'm starting to see why you said "familiarity" factored into this whole thing.

Fields.MenuText: I'm sorry you have to see it, Minneapolis.
It helps that Joe's a freaking saint.
Self-awareness is a hard road. Isn't it?

Fields.DialogueText: I think that if God and his wisdom are part of his universe, then his teachings are also. This was a lesson I was meant to learn. I... I feel like I should talk to Gunhild myself.
I remember back when he started out. He's just supposed to be helping us with some kind of encryption scheme... but he was always so smart. Smarter than I think I realized.
This just hits a little bit too close to home, Captain. Honestly, where I see Gunhild and Joe, I see Marcus and I. No wonder he was so upset.
It's all about working on yourself and what you can do. That's why it's important to make mistakes, learn from them, and move on. Now you get a chance to teach somebody else about it.
I don't want to teach her right this second though, because... Well, you can see them coming, can't you? Jeez lewize; there's a *ton* of them out tonight..!
It's a party; I say, the more the merrier!
More the merrier... Oh, there'll be more, all right. More at the bottom of the ocean.
@BATTLE
Friends? That's childish. We don't know the first things about each other. How can there be trust? How can there be loyalty?
... A lot of this reminds me of something I did. I should talk to Gunhild.
I... Thank you for sticking by me, Captain. But, I think I should go talk to her.
Gunhild! How are you? You look a little bit... brighter than usual? I don't know, maybe it's just the light strands up above; but you look a bit nicer!
It's the ship... Well, you're part right. That conversation with... with your crew member really gave me some things to think about. Why'd you come and talk to me?
Are you a no-nonsense sort, first of all?
Spot on. Harald was lying; you truly do know how to get to the point.
Good then. Listen, you remind me a lot of... well, me. I tend to get people I've never seen before—especially if they're of a different culture—and sometimes I make them feel uncomfortable.
...Hm. I can see why you'd see some of me in you, then. This... party is strange.
Strange in what way?
I will be up front with you as you have been with me.
That's understandable, but what about the others..? Marcus told me you asked him about the color of his feet?
Because I don't know about it! Was his skin that shade because he was born with it? Does he tan in the sun?

Fields.MenuText: Oh, boy.
For some reason, I want to break out in inspirational song.
Well, Minneapolis. Would you care to explain?

Fields.DialogueText: Listen, Gunhild, there's a few things I should tell you about. Namely about skin color...
This is NOT the time for musical numbers, Captain! If you need to sing, s-save that for later! W-What would you even sing about? L-Love!? A-Anyway, Gunhild, there's a few things I need to tell you...
Captain, don't you "Well, Minneapolis" me! I mean, I don't hate it, but don't do that! I've indeed got a few things to explain to you, Gunhild. There's some things about skin color, namely!
What is there to talk about? Have I missed something?
Basically... everyone is born different, Gunhild. The way they look, how they're raised, but all you human beings - you don't know how much you all have in common. You're too close to see it.
The only people who are too close are well-armed strangers in my country's waters, breaking our rules, and causing us panic.
Have we really done any of that, Gunhild?
...You haven't, but... those others have.
Others? What others...?
Captain! Morgana incoming!
Minneapolis, Gunhild! Save this discussion for later! We've got company!
I'm on it, Captain. Come along, Gunhild, I'll show you how we work here.
@BATTLE
I don't like foreigners. I dislike people who enter my country uninvited because of another body that deems us strategically useful.
Listen, we can find you a book about melanin.
To be clear with you, Gunhild. Everyone on this ship, no matter what background, color, race, or creed; everyone here is part of the team. No one's here to do anything to oppress others.
... What you've said and what I've seen backs that up. Indeed.
I hope that this party's proven that to you.

It mostly has. Make no mistake, Minneapolis. Let me be clear when I say: I still don't trust every single one of you, and I still hate that you are here in Sweden unsupervised. I greatly dislike that.
The King's permission? Forgive me, I thought we had the government's.
You do, but I answer to the King. If the King's permission isn't given to you and you trespass on our land, I will not forgive that easily.
Gunhild, I..! ... Dang it.

Fields.MenuText: You did good, Minneapolis.
Some people are harder to reach.
She may not know, but I know what I think of you, Minnie.

Fields.DialogueText: Captain, I... Do you really think so? I wish I could've said something else. It feels like she's just going to cause more trouble... But, Captain... thank you. Thank you.

I'd like to think everyone can be helped. If you can help me out, I feel like I can help Gunhild out... If only I had more time with her; I feel like I'd reach the end. But, that's... maybe for later.
M-Minnie!? Did you just call me Minnie!? ... Captain, don't... don't call me that when we're out here. I... thank you, Captain.
If you want, I can give you some pointers on some conversations if you want. Gunhild seems like the type to listen to reason at the end of it.
I'd appreciate that greatly. I've already been practicing on meeting new people and I could use some more work like always. With you by my side, Captain... I feel like I can help anyone.
And I'll keep helping you, Minneapolis. You can count on that.
Captain... The party's almost over. After this... would you m-maybe like to go to your quarters and drink some coffee?
Why I'd—
Captain, Big Sis! I'm so sorry to interrupt! We're surrounded!
... I've dealt with it before, but this is... ALL RIGHT. I'm going to show these Morgana what happens when you take too many peanuts out of the jar without ASKING!
(Minnesota Nice... I'm starting to think it isn't really nice at all.)
@BATTLE
Unsupervised?
Yes! And without the King's permission!
I... don't know what to think of you, Minneapolis. But thank you for the party.
I'm so grateful that you still know it's me despite me and Gunhild not seeing eye to eye. I want to help her.
I don't know what to make of the business with King Gustav, though. Is she part of some monarchist faction I've never heard of...?
... I miss the days when I didn't have to think about politics. I used to have a few of those.
Come on! Come on! I'm going to show you how we Americans do it!
That's the spirit, one more to go! Advance!
@BATTLE
Looks like the show's over.
And DON't come back! Rabblerousers, all of them!
Not so. That was lovely, Minnie.
There you go again with that name! You did it shortly after the first battle, but I told you not to call me that in front of—
Big Sis! Captain! I've got some news!
Well, don't just be like a maple in the snow; tell us what you know!
It's Gunhild, Big Sis! I saw her... talking to Eliezer! And she was... smiling!
S-Smiling!?

Fields.MenuText: It's a non-season Christmas miracle!
Looks like the Ice Queen's melted.
It's got nothing on yours, Minneapolis.

Fields.DialogueText: I-I believe in miracles at this point! Maybe there is hope after all...
Like Skadi to Sigurd... It's unbelievable... Did I help?
C-Captain! ... I've been brushing my teeth more lately. (DON'T BLUSH DON'T BLUSH DON'T BLUSH!)
Maybe you got through to her after all. Good work, Minneapolis.
Captain... (If you want to reward me for my good behavior, might I suggest....) Can we go talk for a bit? I had some suggestions.
Sounds good to me. Joe, get ready to clean up. Minneapolis and I are going to go discuss battle plans.
You got it, Captain!
Captain...
Yes?
Can you call me... Minnie again?
Of course.
Hah, I'm sorry, Captain. That must've been unsightly.
Strange, they said it'd snow today.
I think it's better that it isn't. Can you imagine trying to navigate through the ice floes?
I come from Minnesota, Captain. I'm quite adept at navigating through snow.

Fields.MenuText: Ice floes in the water are a lot different than snow on land.
I thought you were built in Pennsylvania?
I have no doubt about your skill, Minneapolis, but we need to be careful.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't doubt me, Captain! I know snow quite well. After all, Minnesota's power is with me, so there's nothing to fear on that end.
C-Captain! Yes I was... but! I still have Minnesota's spirit within me. And that's besides the point, I have experience! You don't need to fear anything.
Thank you, Captain... Just, hold onto me tight when I navigate. I don't want you to fear anything when you're with me.
Well, that's reassuring. We head back to Stockholm tomorrow, so I was a bit worried.
Trust in me, Captain. We'll be right as rain. A true Minnesotan knows her way about the flakes.
I trust in you, Minnie.
(You're really making my boiler go overdrive, Captain... C'mon, Minneapolis, hold it in! Don't let Eliezer come back up here and...) I'm so glad you do, Captain. I've been questioning myself a bit.
You have..? What about?
Call me dwelling... I've just been thinking about Gunhild. I wish I could've done more... Though, from what Marcus told me, the rest of the Swedes have been treating him and the others better.
That's good that the Swedes seem to be on our side. But, you have to remember Minneapolis. Sometimes... Sometimes people take time to change.
I just... I did so much for her, and I...
And I have no doubt she'll remember that you did, Minnie. It takes many steps to make a mile after all.
I understand... Mm, Captain, please. I want you to know that I'm going to keep trying to build new parts of the bridge between nations. I want to get back to Stockholm and start learning the culture!
Now there's a step in the right direction. Now all we need is some supplies and to check our weapons.
Good thing some Morganas are about over there. Would you mind if I took a crack at it, Captain?
Go get them, Minnie!
(*blush*) Oh damn it! I'm going to overheaaaat! Let's MOVE IT!
@BATTLE
Be on your toes, everybody! Looks like we're about to experience a little traffic jam up ahead!
Aw. hell no, don't remind me of that! I already get ENOUGH of that in Staten!
Look alive, everybody! Battle time!
@BATTLE
All clear, Captain! Oorah!
Great work, Marcus! What are you going to do now?
Gonna eat is what I'm gonna do. Take care, Captain. Let me know if you need me up here again.
Man, night fell fast, didn't it?
Maybe it's getting closer to winter... Ah, Captain! Look outside! Oh, dear me...
Are we under attack!? Is there something..? Oh...
(Outside of the pale glass lies two seas. One of azure, the other of stars and a half-moon. It's an unusually clear night, and the sparkling lights of the cosmos reflect off of the true blue water.)

Fields.MenuText: Holy...
I can't believe how pretty it all is...
(*The Captain gets closer to Minneapolis.*)

Fields.DialogueText: It's... Where's our photographer!?
This is it. This is nature's miracle...
... (Good criminy Captain, don't do this to me...) (*Minneapolis grasps the Captain's hand.*)
That's a once in a *lifetime* view. If we don't see the aurora, then this is what we have to remember.
I-I don't think that's all I'll remember, Captain.
Minneapolis..?
Captain, I... Could we please get closer?
Here, is... This better? What do we do now?
That's perfect... Let's just... Let's just sit here and watch the stars. We've earned it.
(And after two hours of staring at the cosmos, both of them slept peacefully—visions of the cosmos and snow danced in their heads. Along with... others of romantic desire...)
Ah, Stockholm looks a lot better this time around.
Harald *did* say that the city was going to get cleaned after a recent raid.
I wonder what raid that was? Hopefully, it wasn't as big as the Aesir–Vanir War.
Oh, that's the war between pantheons in Norse mythology, isn't it?
Yes, it was when the two sides fought one another in bloody conflict. They fought until both sides agreed on equal worship, and prosperity followed.

Fields.MenuText: A war between the gods...
I hope after this war's over we get the chance to prosper.
What side are you more partial to in that, MInneapolis?

Fields.DialogueText: It's really hard to think about it in a big sense. Imagine all of the *power* they were working with... I'd love to have Mjolnir or maybe Gugnir as a weapon...
We can only hope, Captain. Like you said, it takes time for people to heal. I don't think I have any sympathies for the Axis, though. Especially after hearing about Eliezer's situation.
Oh, the Aesir. The Vanir may have been fertility gods, but there's no reason for one side or the other to be worshipped more. Everybody should get their chance!
War leads to resolutions, but those resolutions aren't always the best like in that tale.
That entire treaty and then the market crashing... so I've heard. Everything was kind of a perfect storm; so, sounds a lot like a nice summer up in Erie.
I guess weathering the storm's on the menu next. Have you been getting the culture like you wanted?
Yes, actually! They have a really big sense of hospitality, and an equal balance of both work and play here; but nothing too excessive.
And what about their food? Those meatballs were delicious.
There's a big emphasis on fish and sausages here. Had a few nice falukorv in town. There's also pudding and some nice cakes. I'm definitely going to make some mud cake tonight.
Well, now I want a piece!
You can work up that appetite during battle. Radars are picking up some Morgana.
Minnie, can you make that hash dish again, too? For... me please?
Put in some good work in this battle and I'll give you a big amount, Captain!
Okay, I'm on fire now!
@BATTLE
It reminds me a lot of the way I've heard young children play in small towns.
Captain! They told me you went down to the boiler room, then I went upstairs, through the mess hall, and now I'm here... and...
Sorry about that, Minneapolis. I was down there in the hothouse earlier. Eliezer's been complaining of higher temperatures recently and I wanted to see what was up.
H-Have they been running hot lately!? Well, I guess maybe it's the weather. A-Anyway, Captain, I've been noticing something about the Morgana recently.

Fields.MenuText: They've been attacking more?
They tend to be kind of aimless?
They tend to travel in groups?

Fields.DialogueText: They really *have*, but that's not all I've noticed about them. There's more to them than just being completely horrible at ruining moments.
There have been a few outliers. I won't lie that whenever I see them just floating around like that, I wonder if they're at all like... there. But no, there's something else.
That I've noticed, too. They mimic armadas and they always travel in formation. Except of course for the outliers, but that's not the only thing I've noticed.
Well, what else have you noticed about them?
In short, I'm convinced that the Morgana are coming not from like, nothing. Part of me thinks they're... "becoming" thanks to this war.
What do you mean? Just like the fighting itself?
No, Captain, what I'm talking about is the pain, suffering, and... sadness that's going on.
... So you're saying they're formed from tragedy?
Think about it! The war's heating up over in Europe. I've been noticing that the more it does, the more Morganas we've been seeing. If this war gets worse, I feel like we'll be seeing a lot more.
That's interesting... Do you think it has something to do with what the Swedes have been talking about? Lost sailors? Ghosts?
I can't say for sure, Captain, but... Hm, I guess we'll need to see them more.
Well, how about some field research, then? I spot about a group out there.
Sounds good to me. I've been excited to try out some new equipment!
@BATTLE
Hmhm! Hmhm~ Hmhm~
You're in an awfully good mood today, Minneapolis.
I can't help it, Captain. It's been victory after victory with these Morgana and helping out the Swedes, too. And, I finished my wood carving, too!
Oh, what's it of...? Wait, those people... That spear!
I made Odin and the rest of the gods sitting at a feast. I think this'll make a fine addition to my collection.
It's amazing... Hm..? Oh, what the... Minneapolis, it looks like we've got trouble. We've got an emergency distress call from the town of Lulea. The Morgana are laying siege to it.
Not on my watch they won't. When do we get leaving, Captain? I can feel that northern wind calling my name.
Hopefully within the next few hours. I'm trying to streamline the prep work as much as I can.
But those people... Agh, it's frustating, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: It is frustrating - but if we go off half-cocked, we'll be in trouble.
Better to catch the Morgana when they're too busy with the town.
Minnie, I trust you, but I also worry about you.

Fields.DialogueText: It's just... I can imagine all of those people crying, and cowering in fear over those Morgana. Some of them might even be starving...
I... I know that's sound. But, I can't imagine how the people of that town must feel. I want to protect them, but... my crew... Captain...
Captain..! ... Dang it. Dang it all! I just... I'm sorry. I'll hold on.
All in good time. A weapon's check is just what we need right now.
... I've heard about some new forms of ammunition from some of the people back home. It's supposed to dig deeper!
I can see the stars in your eyes...
You know how I get with new ammo and weapons, Captain. And I have you to thank for helping me out.
You can continue to help by... Oh, crap, that Morgana's kind of close.
Time to lend a helping hand, then. Here I come...
@BATTLE
There's so much ice... I knew there would be ice floes, but I wasn't expecting all of this.
Steady as she goes, Minnie. We'll get there eventually.
How are we looking, Joe?
We're doing well. Not too close, not too far. The way things are going we should be there within two hours.
Here I go, then...
This isn't right...
What isn't, Feng?
There's nothing on the radar... (*BEEP*) Mā de! Captain, we've got a... I don't know whether to call this a company or a party; look at all of these MORGANAS!
Incoming enemy salvo! They're too far away to return fire!
N-No! They were... waiting for us!?

Fields.MenuText: Keep it steady... Keep it steady...
Sharp turn starboard, try to get behind that big one!
I'm with you, Minnie - keep it up. I believe in you.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm trying, Captain... Please, please stay near me. Of for crying out! There's so many ice floes...
Right! I'll do what I can... Dang! Can't... They just blew it up!
Captain...! Please...! Please just... (Goodness gracious, hold my hand!)
Minneapolis, take my hand.
C-Captain!?
I'm with you. I'm right here. I promise.
C-Captain...! Rrrgh! (*grunt*) Full... POWER!
Captain! We're in range to retaliate!
Fire at will, let's open that path up!
I'm going to bust you all open like a rotting beehive!
@BATTLE
Now entering Lucea's waters! Morgana dead ahead!
Time for some payback...
We're close now! All cannons, get ready to fire!
@BATTLE
Whew... We made it...
Captain, we did it!!! O-Oh dear, look at the port... A-Are the people all right..?
There's only one way to find out on that one. How are we looking on supplies?
I've got a full cargo hold and I'm ready to start cooking up some rescuing help.

Fields.MenuText: I hope there's some left over.
Going to be a long day...
I'm so proud of you, Minnie

Fields.DialogueText: Don't you worry, Captain. I'll make sure you get a nice heaping amount. You helped me out so much there...
I'll be right there with you, Captain. You were there for me during that mess. Compared to that, this'll be a walk in a park.
Captain... I... Oh for... I'm trying to hold back the tears. Thank you for all of that... I would've panicked...
Together, we're going to help this town get back up on its feet before we leave. But, I've got no idea where to start...
To be frank with you, Captain. I don't have a really good idea, either. I think it's best if we play this by ear. First things first, we should try to find some survivors.
Once we do, we can take a headcount and then let the other ships move in. The sooner we can get the Red Cross out here, the better.
I sometimes forget that there's only so much a good meal can do in place of medical attention...
Don't let that get you down, your food could raise the dead! Every bite has a piece in your heart in it, and I can't get enough...
C-Captain, boiler pressure is—
FINE. I-it's fine.
Hm, well we've got the headcount. Only about 15 people are missing, and about 20 are dead in total. It could've been a lot worse.
We made it through the ice floes just in time... I feel like if we'd been any later.
Well, what matters is that we've made it. Not only have we made it, but everybody's getting fed!

Fields.MenuText: Those children were so happy with the hash.
I wish you could've seen this old woman's face when I gave her a Mud Cake.
Your food would make the Gods smile.

Fields.DialogueText: It makes you smile, Captain. And to me, that's more than enough...
Oh, man! I wish I could've seen that! That would've been beautiful... That Mud Cake was fantastic.
Awww. It warms my heart right up that those young ones are getting fed, too. Hash is delicious. I'm still thankful Harald showed me that.
Good food does great things. I can—
Captain... look! Look at all of those Morganas!
Hell. We need to get back on board, now!
T-There's no way we can possibly get all of them, look how many of them there are!
A counterattack, huh?
(Shells and fires are everywhere around the Captain and Minneapolis alike. They scramble to get aboard and return fire as fast as they can... But it's starting to look more hopeless by the second...)
(That is, until the radio on board Minneapolis recieves a transmission.)
Skal! Greetings from the north, USS Minneapolis! May we intervene here?
Harald! My god, yes!
Don't take the lord's name in vain! Yes, Harald! Back us up! This is it, this our last chance to defend Lucea!
It'd be the pleasure of the Swedish armed forces to assist. Are you ready?
Captain? Say the word!
Engage!
@BATTLE
And now we'll...!
Together with you, Minnie!
And you, Captain..!
Let's finish this!
@BATTLE
Man... Night came really quick, didn't it?
I still can't believe Harald came just in time... But, now Lucea's in good hands. And... I am, too.

Fields.MenuText: Awfully close, aren't you?
Minneapolis, you know I can't resist it when you're like...
Minnie...

Fields.DialogueText: I'll get as close as I want to my Captain, thank you much. Everybody else's gone to celebrate in the Mess Hall.
Everybody's in the Mess Hall, you don't need to anymore. I'm... I've been so quiet during this trip, but now I...
Minnie, Minnie, Minnie... But you're my Captain. But I... There's something I want to tell you, Captain. Right now, while everybody's in the mess hall...
Minneapolis... I... There's a lot this trip that's been on my mind, too.
I told you, I can't read brains, Captain... I want to hear it. I want to hear it from your lips.
... Oh, what's...
Captain? What are you looking at? Oh... Oh my lord...
(A tapestry of many colors, a dancing curtain of green and yellow lights in the night sky...)
It's... It's beautiful...
I guess that makes two once in a lifetime memories...
Captain... If I may... Would you... Like to make a third?
Minnie... I...
(Minneapolis presses a finger to the Captain's lips. And makes a shushing sound.)
Let me, Captain... Thank you for all of this... WIth you I feel like I can do anything...
(Amidst the glimpses of the northern lights, two shadows on the deck join in one small gesture of passion. Though the northern winds of Sweden are cold... love is a warm hearth.)
(It sashays across the onyx and stars like a whispering wind. The beautiful light covers the quaint town in a halo of serenity...)
